page.title: 03KIRTON HORTICULTURE STATION
page.content: Flower bulbs grown at Kirton include daffodils, tulips, iris, lillies and smaller species. Current work assesses new varieties for all commercial purposes, physiological treatment of bulbs and flower forcing methods. Experiments continue using new{ {chemicals}for weed, pest and disease control. A{mechanical chipping machine has been invented and developed by Kirton civil servants to multiply new virus indexed stocks of daffodils more rapidly. All work at the station is checked by the Advisory Committee consisting of local farmers, research staff and Agricultural Development and Advisory Service personnel. Open days are held for the farming public to see the latest developments.
